Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Damn, lost another file. Going to have to reboot. Again. [Windows reboot sound] Hey, Dwight, do you want an Altoid?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In school, we learned about this scientist who trained dogs to salivate at the sound of a bell by feeding them whenever a bell rang. For the last couple of weeks I've been conducting a similar experiment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Windows reboot sound] Dwight, want an Altoid?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Windows reboot sound] Altoid?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Windows reboot sound] Mint Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Inbwit? Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Windows reboot sound] [Dwight holds out his hand, sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know. My mouth tastes so bad all of a sudden. [nasty, dry mouth-smaking noise]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Always the bridesmaids, right ladies?

Quote.Speaker: Photographer
Quote.Text: Okay, for this next one everyone hop out. Just Phyllis and Dad. Actually, let's bring Mom back in. And the sisters. And you, and you, and you. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis is getting married. And I am in the wedding party. She has asked me to push her father's wheelchair down the aisle. So, basically, I am co-giving away the bride. Since I pay her salary it is like I'm paying for the wedding. Which I'm happy to do. It's a big day for Phyllis. But it's an even bigger day for me. Employer of the bride.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes, I put Michael in my wedding. It was the only way I could think to get six weeks off for my honeymoon. No one else has ever gotten six weeks before.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis... ended up using the exact same invitations as Roy and me. So it was kind of like being invited to my own wedding. And I was like 'Wait, thought I called that off'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So what's in the box?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: A toaster, you?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: A toaster.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hi, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You look as beautiful as the Queen of England.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you. Don't linger. Break left. Left!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Shrutes have their own traditions. We usually marry standing in our own graves. Makes the funerals very romantic, but the weddings are a bleak affair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Those flowers are nice.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah. P and R?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phyllis and Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Ah, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Also, Pam and Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There she is. I swear Phyllis you are as beautiful as the first day you started work at Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael. That's sweet. Same as when you said it outside.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How you doin'? You excited.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes, very.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Me, too. If you need to vomit, that is ok. I did. Do you want to talk about tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're probably worried about pleasing Bob. A lot of pressure. Phyllis, did you break wind? It's okay, if you did. It's a very natural reaction. It's your wedding. And you're nervous...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That wasn't me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... umm... I'm sure that Bob... Wow. That is... that is pungent. I lost my train of thought. Aaah... Are you set on that hairstyle?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I thought it was...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here, let me...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael... No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just cover up that bald patch.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't need your... thank you. No, Michael please... I just need some time alone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You might be surprised to learn that I've only been to one other wedding. It's actually a very cute story. My Mom was marrying Jeff. And they asked me to be ring bearer. I was understandably emotional and somehow my pants became wet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in video of Michael as a kid] I hate you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Long story short: Jeff's dog ended up as ring bearer. And the irony is that after the ceremony that dog peed on everything and nobody said 'boo'.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why are all these people here? There are too many people on this Earth. We need a new plague. Who are all these people?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? I bet a lot of them are wedding crashers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you ever see that movie?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course I saw it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I saw Wedding Crashers accidentally. I bought a ticket for Grizzly Man and went into the wrong theatre. After an hour, I figured I was in the wrong theatre, but I kept waiting. That's the thing about bear attacks, they come when you least expect it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know I just wish, I wish, I had the investigative powers to smoke some of these guys out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Once again, Jim, I will take care of this. I will locate the wedding crashers and report them to Phyllis. That way I won't have to get her a gift.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Toby's date] Hi. I'm Kevin. [to Toby] Where did you find her?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: At the gym.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Riiight. The gym. [snickers]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Could you scoot over? You're on my dress.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I thought you're not supposed to wear white to a wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I know but there was an emergency.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I look really good in white.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This strappy young lad sitting here is Phyllis' father, Albert, and he is quite the ladies' man, aren't you Albert, hah? Ah, ringbearer. I could have done better. I will do better. I am going to be better. I can't believe I'm actually doing this! Ooh! Are you ready for this, Albert? I am. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's my dress.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers to father] That's ok. [Albert gets out of his wheelchair and starts walking]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a miracle.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [generalized clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is bull****!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Me walking Phyllis down the aisle was supposed to be the highlight of the wedding. And now... the wedding has no highlight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't believe I pushed that... that guy's lazy ass around all day... until he was ready to stand up and steal the show. That's... well... I got news for you, Albert. If that's your real name. The show's not over.

Quote.Speaker: Priest
Quote.Text: And do you, Phyllis, take Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration, to be your lawfully wedded husband?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and Gentlemen, may I present to you for the first time as a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bob Vance!

Quote.Speaker: Priest
Quote.Text: And do you, Bob...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, shiii...

Quote.Speaker: Priest
Quote.Text: ... take Phyllis to be your lawfully wedded wife

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Priest
Quote.Text: You may now kiss the bride.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and Gentleman, for the first time as a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bob Vance. [generalized clapping and cheering] Yeah! That's what I'm talking about!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Congratulations, Phyllis. You look lovely. Your dress is very white. So white, my eyes are burning.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thanks Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Congratulations, Bob. You're a good man. But just know... if you ever lay a finger on Phyllis, I will kill you.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: If you ever lay I finger on Phyllis, I'll kill you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Agreed. No fingers will be laid on Phyllis. [to Albert] Oh, decided to sit down again, huh? Great. Bet you can hear me, too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Best of luck, Phyllis. Also I'm going to need to see a copy of the guest manifest as well as photographs of the caterers.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't have that, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dammit, Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are you all right? This must be so awful for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well... this was supposed to be your wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh... um... no. That's... um... That's actually fine

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: There's no way it's fine. I'm sorry. If I was you, I would just like freak out and get really drunk and then tell someone I was pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, that's a lot of good ideas. Thanks

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: 'Scuse me, sir. How do you know the happy couple?

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The bride and groom? What are their names?

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: Oh, I... I don't... I'm not sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh I get it, I get it, come on, freeloader. Let's move it. Come on. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: Okay, Okay. Where are we going?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got to find yourself another wedding to crash, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis! Are you happy with everything? What can I do to make it more perfecter?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's beautiful. Why don't you find your seat. Enjoy the buffet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm already on it. The chicken? Totally undercooked. I sent it back.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's fish.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will take care of that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do. I know a fair amount about fine food... and drink. This is a white.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No this is not our first wedding. This is the THIRD wedding that Scrantonicity has played. We also played our bassist's wedding and our guitarist's wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Attention, everyone. Attention, please. I am supposed to ask if anyone has seen Uncle Al. He is old and has brown eyes and dementia. His family is very concerned. It is a very serious situation. [sings] Roxanne. You don't have to put on your red light.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I know I normally don't notice these kind of things but uh... This wedding's really nice! I mean, the flowers and stuff? Phyllis has got some great taste.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're kidding me, right?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I know you're probably not going to remember this, right? But um... Those color roses? I got you those color roses for our prom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy, I picked those flowers. Phyllis just stole all of my ideas for our wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I uh guess I wasn't really too involved in the planning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You think this sucks for you? I was the one who actually wanted to get married.

Quote.Speaker: Randy
Quote.Text: Phyllis, you're a wonderful woman. And you're a hell of a bowler!

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: [cheering and clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Unknown
Quote.Text: She is.

Quote.Speaker: Randy
Quote.Text: Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Crowd
Quote.Text: Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Randy. That was great. Thank you. Thank you very much. Hi, I'm Michael Scott and for the next forty minutes, I'm going to be your tour guide through the lives of Phyllis Lapin and Bob Vance. One of the great, seemingly impossible, love stories of our time. My name is Michael Scott. Webster's Dictionary defines "wedding" as the fusing of two metals with a hot torch. Well, you know something. I think you guys are two metals. Gold medals. For those of you who don't know me, I'm Michael Scott, Phyllis' boss. To quote from The Princess Bride "Mawige...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The most important part of a speech is the opening line. When time is not a factor, I like to try out three or four different ones.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis and Bob: their celebrity couple name would be Phlob. You look at her... and she's kind of matronly today, but back in High School, I swear, her nickname was 'Easy Rider'. Now as for Bob... Bob Vance...

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Oh okay. That's enough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: is a guy that...

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael. Give me...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: he works... Okay hold, hold on, hold on. Look. Look. I didn't say anything when Phyllis' dad upstaged me at the ceremony. And I think you owe me this. Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Give me the microphone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I'm not going to...

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Give me... Give me the microphone, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. All right.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: You're out of here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Yeah. You're out of here! You're... Yeah. I hate you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When are we going to get to see some of those famous Beesly dance moves?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh... I'm pacing myself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on. Get out there. Give the people what they want.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. I'm such a dorky dancer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. It's very cute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hypothetically, if I thought Pam was interested, then... No, it's totally hypothetical.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come... Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't let you in, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, just...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's Bob and Phyllis' orders.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, I just wanted to go in and quietly sit and have a piece of cake. I'm not even going to dance one song.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are a real life wedding crasher and I must bounce you. I'm sorry, it gives me no pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, they're playing our song.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's weird. I thought they only played the Police.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I know. Uh... I gave them twenty bucks. You want to dance?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sings] ee... I was meant for you... buppity du bom bu.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Hey, want to get out of here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here's a 'not hypothetical'. I'm really happy I'm with Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [sings] Every little thing she does is magic. Every little thing she do just turns me on. Even though my life before was tragic. Now I know my love for her goes on. Every...

Quote.Speaker: Women
Quote.Text: One... Two... Three. Ahhhh! [Phyllis throws the flowers, Ryan knocks them out of Kelly's hands, Toby's date gets them]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Toby! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just want Phyllis to have a great day.

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: Phyllis and you will be great together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are great together. We are a great team.

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: The Celtics were a great team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes. They were. Robert Parrish! I should talk to her. I don't want this to ruin her honeymoon.

Quote.Speaker: Uncle Al
Quote.Text: Nobody ever helped me. I had to do it myself. Even the doctor didn't know!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dude, keep it together. I listened to you for half an hour even though most of that stuff went right over my head.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis. Phyllis! Wait! Please. I'm sorry. I just... I just wanted to make this a day to remember.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You found Uncle Al!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. He's kind of a weirdo.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're... You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They say that your wedding day goes by in such a flash that your lucky if you even get a piece of your own cake. I say that's crazy. I say let them eat cake. Margaret Thatcher said that about marriage. Smart broad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Be careful. Oh no!! [Phyllis and Bob smear cake on each other's face] Oh wow! Phyllis! Phyllis! You look like a clown! Here. Get me! Get me! [Michael smears cake on his own face]
